members.member: A component that detects collisions of a modifiable severity and plays the configured haptics. Author: Intuitive Gaming Solutions

member.name: P:HapticsSystem.PlayHapticsOnCollision.LastHapticsPlayRealTime
member.summary: Returns the last Time.realTimeSinceStartup this component played haptics.

member.name: M:HapticsSystem.PlayHapticsOnCollision.PlayHaptics(System.Single)
member.summary: Plays haptics for a collision with a normalized severity (0 to 1) of pNormalizedSeverity. Higher severity increases haptic amplitude within the specified range. Higher severity increases haptic frequency within the specified range.

members.member:
The haptics driver is responsible for actually playing haptics for an input device.
Author: Mathew Aloisio

member.name: M:HapticsSystem.IHapticsDevice.TryHapticImpulse(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Attempts to play a haptic pulse with the specified parameters on all devices registered with this haptics device. Note that haptics will only play while the haptics device component is enabled.

member.name: M:HapticsSystem.IHapticsDevice.PlayHapticImpulse(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Attempts to play a haptic pulse with the specified parameters on all devices registered with this haptics device. NOTE: This differs from 'TryHapticImpulse' in that it will play the impulse regardless of whether or not the component is enabled.

member.name: M:HapticsSystem.IHapticsDevice.StopHaptics
member.summary: Stops haptics on all registered haptic devices.
